newsitem.title: JAPAN: Toyota to start sales of hybrid system cars in '97.
newsitem.headline: Toyota to start sales of hybrid system cars in '97.

text.p: Toyota Motor Co said on Wednesday that it has developed a highly advanced hybrid power system for use in mass-produced passenger cars and will launch sales of passenger cars using the system later this year.

Under the new system, called the Toyota Hybrid System, a gasoline engine, electric motor and electric generator are used to achieve nearly twice the fuel efficiency of conventional gasoline engine cars and drastically reduce exhaust emissions.

The new system came after Toyota succeeded in developing environment-friendly, low fuel consumption engines such as a lean-burn engine in 1984 and a direct injection gasoline engine in 1996, the nation's biggest carmaker said in a statement.
An improved-efficiency gasoline engine provides the main power to drive the wheels, as in conventional automobiles.
Drive power can also be supplied by an electric motor, which derives its electricity from the nickel-metal hydride battery and an electric generator, it said.
